definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
layer filled with rammed earth in a tomb pit (archeology)

sentences.english: Tulou building usually consists of rammed earth outer wall and internal wooden framework.
sentences.chinese: 土楼建筑通常由夯土外墙和内部木制结构组成。

sentences.english: The building's self-supporting outer shell is comprised of solid walls made of rammed earth.
sentences.chinese: 建筑的自支撑式外墙结构由夯土实体墙构成。

sentences.english: The wall was built by stamping earth between board frames.
sentences.chinese: 这面土墙是夯土版筑而成。

sentences.english: Concerned about the differences in design parameters between this and adobe?
sentences.chinese: 担心夯土和砖头之间设计参数的差异吗？

sentences.english: The rammed earth building possesses superior indoor thermal environment and durability.
sentences.chinese: 夯土建筑具有优越的室内热环境和耐久性。

sentences.english: The outer walls, made of rammed earth, protected against bandits.
sentences.chinese: 土楼的外墙由夯土砌成，用于防止土匪的骚扰。

sentences.english: The rammed earth provides a good thermal mass and also helps control humidity.
sentences.chinese: 在夯土提供了良好的热质量，也有助于控制湿度。

definition: variant of 版築|版筑[ban3 zhu4]
to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
to build by laying bricks or stones
